question.title: Launch minecraft with cli
question.body:
I try to launch Minecraft from terminal, and i have a problem, the access token isn't recognize the arg of command (offline account but token is required)

I have made a bash script to launch it with dependencies

The logs :

2024-02-29 17:08:56,173 main ERROR Error processing element Queue ([Appenders: null]): CLASS_NOT_FOUND
2024-02-29 17:08:56,475 main ERROR Unable to locate appender "ServerGuiConsole" for logger config "root"
Exception in thread "main" joptsimple.MissingRequiredOptionException: Missing required option(s) ['accessToken']
    at joptsimple.OptionParser.ensureRequiredOptions(OptionParser.java:375)
    at joptsimple.OptionParser.parse(OptionParser.java:365)
    at net.minecraft.client.main.Main.main(SourceFile:53)

I'm newer at java and i don't have good level in java, my script :

#!/bin/bash
command='/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.8.0-openjdk-amd64/bin/java -Djava.library.path=native/ -cp minecraft-1.8.9-client.jar:joptsimple.jar:lwjgl.jar:lwjgl_util.jar:guava-17.0.jar:log4j-api.jar:log4j-core.jar:gson-2.8.2.jar:commons-lang3.jar net.minecraft.client.main.Main --username Lodak --version 1.8.9 --gameDir ./.minecraft --assetsDir ./assets --assetIndex 1.8 --uuid --accessToken e0e1c613a7634006aaa50a4783ddc6bd --userProperties --userType Offline'
echo "SH Script command : $command"
$command

And the last question, why this line is here with ServerGuiConsole for the client jar : 2024-02-29 17:08:56,475 main ERROR Unable to locate appender "ServerGuiConsole" for logger config "root"

Thank you for your time, have a good day

OpenJDK 8 Minecraft 1.8.9 AMD3015e x86_64 CPU Linux 6.7.4 custom build Ubuntu 24.04 Noble Numbat (dev branch)

I have use the PolyMC minecraft jar, assets and linux natives

For other jar files is directly download with good version for 1.8.9

The accessToken used is an offline token randomly generated by PolyMC, used for the test, so you cannot use this same to login MSA auth, because it's a random token
